places.name: places/ChIJHQiw0jLDw0cRGByiNcQdT7g
places.adrFormatAddress: Av. Jules Bordet 1, Haren 1140 Evere, Belgium

text.text:
I recently visited Decathlon Evere, Brussels and had a fantastic shopping experience, thanks in large part to David from the fishing department. Here are some highlights of my visit:

David's Exceptional Service:
David from the fishing department provided an exceptional level of service that truly stood out. Not only was he incredibly kind, but he was also highly professional and knowledgeable about all the products. David took the time to explain everything we needed to know with honesty and clarity, ensuring we understood our options without over-suggesting items we didn’t need. His genuine approach and expert advice made our shopping experience enjoyable and stress-free.

Store Layout and Organization:
The store layout is well-organized, making it easy to navigate through various sections. Each sport and activity has its dedicated area, with clear signage and ample space to browse products. This thoughtful arrangement allows customers to find what they need without feeling overwhelmed.

Product Range and Availability:
Decathlon Evere offers an impressive range of products for a wide variety of sports and outdoor activities. From running and cycling to hiking and swimming, the store has everything an enthusiast could ask for. The stock levels were excellent, and I found everything I was looking for without any issues.

Quality and Value:
The products at Decathlon are known for their quality and affordability, and this store is no exception. I purchased several items, including a pair of running shoes, a hiking backpack, and some gym equipment. Each product was well-made and offered great value for the price.

Customer Service:
Overall, the customer service at Decathlon Evere was outstanding. While David was a standout, the rest of the staff were also friendly and helpful. They provided valuable advice on product selection and answered all my questions with patience and expertise. Their enthusiasm for sports was evident and added to the positive shopping experience.

Checkout Process:
The checkout process was smooth and efficient. There were multiple counters open, which minimized wait times. Additionally, the self-checkout option was a convenient alternative for those in a hurry.

Additional Services:
I also appreciated the additional services offered by the store, such as equipment rental and repair services. These extras demonstrate Decathlon’s commitment to customer satisfaction and make it a one-stop shop for all sporting needs.

Overall Experience:
My experience at Decathlon Evere was fantastic, largely due to the exceptional service provided by David in the fishing department. The store’s wide product range, excellent customer service, and commitment to quality and value make it a top choice for sports enthusiasts. I highly recommend this store to anyone looking for reliable and affordable sports equipment and gear.

text.text:
As every year I get my snowboard serviced with Decathlon Evere. They always do a great work (merci RP en particulier). Only this time they lost two key metal pieces of the board and I could not use it anymore. They immediately acted by taking responsibility for the loss and offered to pay for the replacement of the missing elements.
Well done Team Decathlon Evere (in particular Killian and James), impressed with your customer solution oriented mind! Highly appreciated!

originalText.text:

text.text: I recently visited Decathlon Evere and had an exceptional shopping experience. This store is incredibly spacious and well-stocked, catering to a wide range of sports and outdoor activities. During my visit, I purchased a camping kit and underwater swimming accessories, and I am thoroughly satisfied with both the products and the service.The camping section was extensive, offering everything from tents and sleeping bags to portable cooking equipment and camping furniture. I was able to find a high-quality camping kit that included all the essentials for a comfortable outdoor adventure. The variety of options available made it easy to select the right gear for my needs, and the prices were very reasonable, providing excellent value for money.In the swimming section, I found a comprehensive range of underwater swimming accessories, including snorkels, masks, and fins. The quality of these products was impressive, designed to enhance the underwater experience. The staff were knowledgeable and provided helpful recommendations, ensuring I chose the right equipment for my level of experience and intended use.The overall layout of the store was well-organized, making it easy to navigate through different sections. The displays were informative, and the products were arranged logically, allowing for a smooth shopping experience. Additionally, the store was clean and well-maintained, contributing to a pleasant atmosphere.What stood out the most was the customer service. The staff at Decathlon Evere were friendly, approachable, and eager to assist. They provided valuable insights into the products, helping me make informed decisions. Their expertise and willingness to help made my shopping experience even better.Decathlon Evere is truly a one-stop shop for all outdoor enthusiasts. Whether you are looking for camping gear, swimming accessories, or equipment for other sports, this store has it all. The combination of a vast product range, competitive pricing, and excellent customer service makes it a top choice for anyone in need of quality sports and outdoor gear.I highly recommend Decathlon Evere and will definitely be returning for my future sporting and outdoor needs.

text.text: Staff speaks excellent English too. Highly skilled professionals at bike section. The store is large, free to try bikes inside. You can also take a bike out for a ride if you give them your passport to hold.

All kind of sports item,like water bottle to gym items are available. Customer support is excellent. You can experience every item. You can get good quality items in low cost. The best thing is no one is forcing to buy anything,you can choose peaceful whatever you want.

text.text: very great store....lots of stuff for the bike and also for trekking, tent, inflatable mats, great very light mattress...cooking equipment...a lot of things and today great shoes for trekking but also for the bike....they are waterproof I didn't expect it when I checked it... hot rock bt shoes...

text.text:
I understand it is 'spring' and we're nearing the summer, but to have no waterproof clothes (cycling) available because of them being, and I quote the store staff, "winter items"? Pardon?

Do correct or tell me, but as a Belgian myself, since when does it only rain here in the damn winter??

Especially infuriating since they were in stock on the website and massive signs on the building saying "everything in stock"...

Not an enjoyable experience.

text.text: Extremely customer friendly. I came here because I had a problem with my bike (I bought there 2 months earlier) and they looked what they could do, but when they said it would take about 3 weeks to repair (Because they had to send my bike to Bornem) they gave me another bike for the periode I didn't have my bike. This is the example of how you should treat clients. On top of all these, they have a lot of products of all sports and not expensive at all.

places.name: places/ChIJzT91zIDDw0cRD6CeMhw4-R8
places.adrFormatAddress: Rue de l'Evêque 30, Pentagone 1000 Bruxelles, Belgium

text.text:
Unfortunately, it seems that the digital inventory management between the website and the actual store is completely off. I went by for some equipment which should have been in stock. Not only were those specific products not in stock, the entire sport was "no longer supported" by the store.

This is of course not the fault of the specific employees working at the store at that moment, they apologized for the inconvenience. Still, an up to date inventory would have prevented this fruitless visit.

text.text:
Decathlon Brussels: A One-Stop Shop for all sportswear ! Huge selection - from running shoes to kayaks, they've got it all.  Great prices on quality gear.

The staff is friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable, ready to answer your questions.  Finding things is easy, thanks to the well-organized layout.

originalText.text:
Decathlon Brussels: A One-Stop Shop for all sportswear ! Huge selection - from running shoes to kayaks, they've got it all.  Great prices on quality gear.

The staff is friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable, ready to answer your questions.  Finding things is easy, thanks to the well-organized layout.

text.text:
I like this sports shops, I don't intend to complain but I will start with the 2 things I did not like about it. It's hidden underground next to Metro and so it was tough to find from Google maps, and the second thing is that because it has everything in sports, it has little of each. If you want a running shoes, you will find a small collection...
The shop has self scanning/payment which I like a lot, and it has an honest return policy. Once I asked for an item to be returned, and it went smoothly, I respect that and I will be coming back again.

text.text: DON'T use their bike atelier, it's a disaster. I brought my e-bike for the 6-months free check up they offer THREE WEEKS ago and I'm still waiting for my bike. Unbelievable. No alternative option offered.

text.text:
A complete disappointment.
I left my bike 2 months ago for the annual checkup. It seems some small parts had to be replaced, but I still have no news from them.

LE: they offered the service for free

text.text:
Decathlon is decathlon, good prices, decent quality.
Perhaps could do with a few more employees, sometimes difficult to find someone to ask a question or help. There tend to be people waiting in line to pay, perhaps add some more stations to process items to speed it up?

originalText.text:
Decathlon is decathlon, good prices, decent quality.
Perhaps could do with a few more employees, sometimes difficult to find someone to ask a question or help. There tend to be people waiting in line to pay, perhaps add some more stations to process items to speed it up?

text.text: You can find equipment for almost every sport imaginable. Most products are very affordable, but that also means they are not always high-end products. For some sports (like diving) you will find the basic equipment, but if you want more advanced equipment this is not the place to be. You only have 1 type of most products anyway, so there is not a lot to compare.

For some sports (like diving) you will find the basic equipment, but if you want more advanced equipment this is not the place to be. You only have 1 type of most products anyway, so there is not a lot to compare.

text.text: Very competent and easy going. You clearly see that they don’t want to give you a hard time. Excellent!

originalText.text: Very competent and easy going. You clearly see that they don’t want to give you a hard time. Excellent!

text.text: Last Saturday morning I had an appointment with the atelier for a free bike check. I bought my bike in Decathlon and a free check-up is included before 6 months. The guy attending was very dry and rude, he told me I had to leave my bike there for one week because they are overloaded or pay for the express service (15 euros). The express service option was not an option because I didn’t book it in advance. I agreed to leave my bike and then he says I have to remove the kid bike seat if I want them to check my bike. Very bad service and very bad attendance. Not happy with them. Don’t offer a service if you can’t do it.

The express service option was not an option because I didn’t book it in advance. I agreed to leave my bike and then he says I have to remove the kid bike seat if I want them to check my bike. Very bad service and very bad attendance. Not happy with them. Don’t offer a service if you can’t do it.

text.text: Perfect quality and good worker

originalText.text: Perfect quality and good worker

text.text:
I went to buy a couple of backpacks and also to see and try a model of bicycle they have online for sale, the Joieem electric bike, since I will not buy a 2400€ bike without trying it, I asked around and all the answer were negative, they do not have it on show and they only have it online, basically “buy it and then try it”.
It was very disappointing since I find that model to fit my needs and I would’ve love to try it before buying it to make sure it fits well and it’s fine for my size, I do not understand how they expect to sell this bicycle that is not cheap at all, without letting their customers try it, it’s like buying a car without seating in it first or even being able to see it physically…

text.text: Staff has improved recently, very helpful. Selection is great, I always find what I'm looking for. Sometime prices ring up more than they should be, so always check your ticket. Free wi-fi

originalText.text: Staff has improved recently, very helpful. Selection is great, I always find what I'm looking for. Sometime prices ring up more than they should be, so always check your ticket. Free wi-fi

text.text: Good decathlon, don’t recommend going on a Saturday because of the amount of people going at the same time.

originalText.text: Good decathlon, don’t recommend going on a Saturday because of the amount of people going at the same time.

text.text: I'm usually quite mild in my opinions but I would advise anyone to avoid this place at all cost. The store is filthy and poorly maintained, debris everywhere. Items that have been tried on by people are littered everywhere. Open a fitting booth and I guarantee you will find a mountain of stuff inside. Hardly any inventory in the isles (because it's spread across the store). Personnel is almost without exception french speaking. People are allowed to let their children roam free, touch everything and cause ruckus everywhere. Check-out lines are long and check-out personnel is not friendly. I don't know what management of this store is up to. If you have the choice, I would advise to go to the store in Evere or Oostakker instead.

text.text: Mediocre sports goods store. Very big but very poorly stocked on the most obvious sports clothing.

originalText.text: Mediocre sports goods store. Very big but very poorly stocked on the most obvious sports clothing.

text.text: Extremely helpful personnel, clean and tidy store

originalText.text: Extremely helpful personnel, clean and tidy store

text.text:
I really like Decathlon. It is a one-stop shop for all your needs for sports and hiking. They have cheap products as well higher quality products with more expensive prices. Something for everyone!

This Decathlon in particular is a huge one and is very comfortable to shop at.

Loving the RFID checkout!

originalText.text:

This Decathlon in particular is a huge one and is very comfortable to shop at.

Loving the RFID checkout!

text.text: Good store.  Quite a large selection of goods for everyone. One thing is difficult to park, small spaces for small cars, maybe because it’s Saturday.

originalText.text: Good store.  Quite a large selection of goods for everyone. One thing is difficult to park, small spaces for small cars, maybe because it’s Saturday.

text.text: My wife and I went there 2 weeks ago to buy a bike for her, in the cashier section, Ms. Auri helped us a lot and her kindness and big smile made our purchase memorable. I want to take this opportunity and express my gratitude to her. She made our day.

originalText.text: My wife and I went there 2 weeks ago to buy a bike for her, in the cashier section, Ms. Auri helped us a lot and her kindness and big smile made our purchase memorable. I want to take this opportunity and express my gratitude to her. She made our day.

text.text: I really like Decathlon. I have nothing but excellent experiences with the bicycle repair department, and employees in general are knowledgable, involved and friendly. Poor stock was a problem during the Corona crisis, but it seems most items are available now. The cycling and camping equipment I have tried always seems well designed and punches far above its weight price-wise.

originalText.text: I really like Decathlon. I have nothing but excellent experiences with the bicycle repair department, and employees in general are knowledgable, involved and friendly. Poor stock was a problem during the Corona crisis, but it seems most items are available now. The cycling and camping equipment I have tried always seems well designed and punches far above its weight price-wise.

text.text: Great collection. You can literally find everything here from stuffs related to sports, cycling, fitness, trekking and all you can think of. Protein bars, shakes, dumbbell weights, boxing equipments, tennis ,badminton racquets all available here. They string the badminton and tennis racquets here as well. For badminton they only charge the price for the string. The labor charge for stringing is free of cost. People always around to help.

Protein bars, shakes, dumbbell weights, boxing equipments, tennis ,badminton racquets all available here. They string the badminton and tennis racquets here as well. For badminton they only charge the price for the string. The labor charge for stringing is free of cost. People always around to help.

text.text: Big sports & leisure shop with very big assortment. Friendly and helpfull staff

originalText.text: Big sports & leisure shop with very big assortment. Friendly and helpfull staff

text.text: Lazy, ignorant staff unwilling to serve after several attempts. Too busy talking to eachother with 3 of them. Left my full trolly at the check out and ran from the place. Will not go back there.

originalText.text: Lazy, ignorant staff unwilling to serve after several attempts. Too busy talking to eachother with 3 of them. Left my full trolly at the check out and ran from the place. Will not go back there.

text.text: One of the best not expensive sports shops what I have seen.

originalText.text: One of the best not expensive sports shops what I have seen.

text.text: Very friendly and helpful staff, even helped to carry my purchases downstairs and into my car. Nice selection of products (They are even expanding right now).

originalText.text: Very friendly and helpful staff, even helped to carry my purchases downstairs and into my car. Nice selection of products (They are even expanding right now).

text.text:
As always, very friendly, customer focused, and helpful people in this shop. I have been coming to this store since they opened up, and I have never been disappointed.
I would not recommend the Decathlon online store or contacting the Decathlon customer services desk for that matter. You will be disappointed and be very frustrated about the lack of service. Instead, buy your stuff in this store. They can even order whatever the online store is selling for you.

Update to give credit where credit is due.
After 3 days of trying to convince their customer services desk to deliver an already paid order, getting the Lier shop involved, and hearing them promise the shop that they will contact me ASAP and deliver the order, no one from this desk reached out to me.
Yesterday I made my final attempt, but this time I got someone on the phone that  truly understood customer satisfaction and saved the day for Decathlon. Christine (not sure if that is her real name) did not lie,and  made no lame excuses. Instead she was very candid about what went wrong and she promised to follow-up this case. And she did! And made sure that the order finally got delivered. So kudos to Christine!

text.text: Really frendly and helpful personnel. We bought a bike there and the staff was very helpful with practical information. Thay also have a good warranty and a fast repair. It is on the 1st floor but you have a very spacious elevator.

text.text: This is without a doubt the smallest Decathlon you'll ever set foot in, but a descent variety of the well-known housebrands available and friendly and helpful staff.

places.adrFormatAddress: Steenweg op Gierle 221, Turnhout 2300 Turnhout, Belgium

text.text: I was there looking for mountain bikes. Workers are very helpful and informative.  A lot of parking lots. There are many shops around its location (such as Action, Media Markt, etc). Also it is not far from Carefour (big supermarkt)

text.text: Less busy between 5pm and 7pm

text.text: Very big stor. Big parking and in the shop you are feeling alone. As a child in the dark forest. So many products but the information where are the products is really not big and not enough . In the reality you have to be patient and take a your time to find what are you looking for.

text.text: Typical Decathlon. Bought small shorts there - but had to use the normal cashier, as the automatic scanner read the "9 EUR" price tag as "10 EUR". But otherwise a very good shop of course.

text.text: These boys sell some tings here that can be used to do all types of workouts and hobby. The store aint cute but it big tho like damn that store huge and like im noy attracted to it but its kinda fire yk like the vibe do be there ngl so if you ever need to work out or somethign go here
